allow:
Bash(.specify/scripts/powershell/create-new-feature.ps1 -Json "Module 1: The Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2)
Target audience: University students with AI/CS background learning Physical AI for humanoid robotics
Focus: Middleware for robot control, bridging Python AI agents to ROS controllers, URDF for humanoids; emphasize embodied intelligence in physical environments
Success criteria:
- Covers 4+ core ROS 2 concepts with practical examples
- Includes 5+ code snippets testable in ROS 2 Humble on Ubuntu 22.04
- Reader can build and launch a simple humanoid URDF node after reading
- All technical claims supported by official ROS docs or tutorials
- Integrates with hardware reqs (e.g., Jetson Orin for deployment)
Constraints:
- Chapter count: 4 chapters matching weeks 3-5 (e.g., Architecture, Nodes/Topics/Services, Python Packages, Launch/Params)
- Word count per chapter: 1500-2500 words
- Format: MDX with code blocks (Python/rclpy), Mermaid diagrams for node graphs, LaTeX for equations (e.g., transform math)
- Sources: Official ROS 2 docs, tutorials; 5+ references per chapter, APA style
- Timeline: Generate within 1 hour per spec
- Assessments: 2 quizzes (multiple-choice on concepts), 3 exercises (e.g., build ROS package for humanoid joint control)
- Diagrams: 3+ per chapter (e.g., ROS graph, URDF tree)
- Exercises: Hands-on labs (e.g., simulate bipedal publisher/subscriber)
Not building:
- Full ROS 1 comparison
- Advanced real-time extensions (e.g., ROS 2 real-time)
- Vendor-specific hardware integrations beyond Jetson
- Ethical discussions on robot control" -Json -Number 1 -ShortName "ros2-textbook" "Module 1: The Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2)")
